titlestmt.titleproper: Guide to the William McFee Collection
titlestmt.author: by Karen Spicher

publicationstmt.publisher: Beinecke Rare Book and Manuscript Library

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace on Wednesday March 27, 2019 at 03:06

repository.corpname: Beinecke Rare Book and Manuscript Library

did.abstract: The William McFee Collection contains correspondence between McFee and literary colleagues, publishers, friends, and family; third-party correspondence concerning McFee, his family, and his friendship with James T. Babb; autograph manuscript or typescript drafts for most of McFee's novels, and for short stories, essays, books reviews, and poems; autograph manuscript diaries, 1911-1963; writings of others, including Margery Allingham and Beatrice Allender McFee; photographs of McFee and others; drawings of McFee and illustrations for his writings by Arthur J. Elder and others; a bronze bust of McFee by Jason Sturm (Yale 1922); scrapbooks containing clippings about McFee, reviews of his writings, photographs, and ephemera; other clippings about McFee; personal papers, mostly concerning McFee's family or his work as a marine engineer; correspondence relating to Babb's collecting of books and manuscripts by McFee, and research materials and drafts for A Bibliography of the Writings of William McFee; audiotapes relating to McFee's 75th birthday in 1956; and films and videocassettes of McFee and his family. Major correspondents include Margery Allingham, other members of the Allingham family, James T. Babb, Van Wyck Brooks, Arthur J. Elder, George T. Keating, Beatrice Allender McFee, other members of the McFee family, Byrne Marconnier, Harry E. Maule, Christopher Morley, Dudley Nichols, and Frank Swinnerton.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: Organized into two groupings: Acquisitions, 1948-1972 and 1983; and Acquisitions, 1979-2002.

bioghist.head: William McFee (1881-1966)
bioghist.p: William McFee (Yale 1936 MA honorary), marine engineer, and author of maritime fiction. McFee was born in London, moved to the United States in 1911, and became an American citizen in 1925, settling in Roxbury, Connecticut. He served as an engineer in the British navy during World War I, and for the United Fruit Company and other merchant ships, 1906-1924. McFee wrote maritime novels, short stories, and essays, and reviewed books about the sea for the The Sun (New York) and the New York Times . He was married to Pauline Khondoff, 1920-1932, and novelist Beatrice Allender, 1932-1952; he later married Dorothy North, and was stepfather of North's son Richard McFee.

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access
accessrestrict.p: The materials are open for research.
Boxes 93-95: Restricted until 2033 September 24. For more information, consult the appropriate curator.
Box 92 (reel-to-reel audiotapes) and box 103 (16mm films): Restricted fragile material. Reference copies may be requested. Consult Access Services for further information.
Boxes 106-107: Restricted fragile material. Consult Access Services for further information.

userestrict.head: Conditions Governing Use
userestrict.p: The William McFee Collection is the physical property of the Beinecke Rare Book and Manuscript Library, Yale University. Literary rights, including copyright, belong to the authors or their legal heirs and assigns. For further information, consult the appropriate curator.

acqinfo.head: Immediate Source of Acquisition
acqinfo.p: Gift of James T. Babb, (Yale 1924), 1952-1968, gift of Harry E. Maule, 1954 and 1970, and gift of Margaret Bradley Babb, 1983; and acquired from other donors and vendors, 1948-2002, as indicated in subseries and folder notes. For more information consult the appropriate curator.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: William McFee Collection. General Collection, Beinecke Rare Book and Manuscript Library, Yale University.

relatedmaterial.head: Related Materials
relatedmaterial.p: McFee, William. Miscellaneous pamphlets and other ephemera by and about William McFee (Iq M167 +1).
Other books owned by McFee may be found in the online catalog by searching "McFee, William" as a special collections subject or "Iq M167" as a local call number.

processinfo.head: Processing Information
processinfo.p: Former call numbers: MS Vault McFee, Uncat MS Vault McFee, Uncat MS Vault 272, Uncat MS Vault 304, Uncat MS Vault 305, Uncat MS Vault 306, Uncat MS Vault 743, Uncat MS Vault 761, Uncat MSS 82, Uncat MSS 309, Uncat Ms Vault File, Iq M167 1, Iq M167 +1, Iq M167 904, Iq M167 912, Iq M167 C1, Iq M167 G1, Artstore 674, Artstore 675, Artstore 677, Artstore 678, Artstore 679, Artstore 680, Artstore 681, Artstore 682, and Artstore 885. In 2014, the collection received a baseline level of processing, including partial rehousing and minimal organization. The collection was reclassed under one call number, materials were organized by acquisition, and containers were renumbered in a single sequence. Most folder titles were based on information provided by the creator, while some were assigned by Library staff. Folder titles were not verified against contents.

bioghist.head: James T. Babb (1899-1968)
bioghist.p: James T. Babb (Yale 1924), book and manuscript collector; Yale University Librarian, 1943-1965. Babb collected books and manuscripts by William McFee and was the author of A Bibliography of the Writings of William McFee (Garden City, N.Y.: Doubleday, Doran & Company, 1931).

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: The William McFee Collection contains correspondence between McFee and literary colleagues, publishers, friends, and family; third-party correspondence concerning McFee, his family, and his friendship with James T. Babb; autograph manuscript or typescript drafts for most of McFee's novels, and for short stories, essays, books reviews, and poems; autograph manuscript diaries, 1911-1963; writings of others, including Margery Allingham and Beatrice Allender McFee; photographs of McFee and others; drawings of McFee and illustrations for his writings by Arthur J. Elder and others; a bronze bust of McFee by Jason Sturm (Yale 1922); scrapbooks containing clippings about McFee, reviews of his writings, photographs, and ephemera; other clippings about McFee; personal papers, mostly concerning McFee's family or his work as a marine engineer; correspondence relating to Babb's collecting of books and manuscripts by McFee, and research materials and drafts for A Bibliography of the Writings of William McFee; audiotapes relating to McFee's 75th birthday in 1956; and films and videocassettes of McFee and his family. Major correspondents include Margery Allingham, other members of the Allingham family, James T. Babb, Van Wyck Brooks, Arthur J. Elder, George T. Keating, Beatrice Allender McFee, other members of the McFee family, Byrne Marconnier, Harry E. Maule, Christopher Morley, Dudley Nichols, and Frank Swinnerton.

userestrict.head: Conditions Governing Use
userestrict.p: Videocassettes (in box 100): Use of originals is restricted. Reference copies may be requested. Consult Access Services for further information.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: Organized into seven subseries: Correspondence, Writings, Writings of Others, Printed Material, Personal Papers, Photographs and Other Visual Materials, and James T. Babb Research Materials.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Contains materials acquired from James T. Babb, Harry E. Maule, and other sources through 1972, and from Margaret Bradley Babb, 1983. These materials were partially integrated prior to 2014.

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access
accessrestrict.p: Box 92 (audiovisual material): Restricted fragile. Reference copies may be requested. Consult Access Services for further information.

relatedmaterial.head: Related Materials
relatedmaterial.p: Additional correspondence is in the Writings and James T. Babb Research Materials subseries.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Includes incoming and outgoing correspondence, with most large groups of letters from McFee noted in folder titles. Letters concern McFee's writing; his relationships with literary colleagues, friends, and family; and the United Fruit Company and other marine engineering work. Some letters include writings, publisher contracts, royalty statements, or photographs. Third-party correspondence contains letters about McFee between James T. Babb, members of the McFee family, and friends of McFee.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: Arranged alphabetically by correspondent, followed by third-party correspondence and unsorted correspondence.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Contains drafts for novels, short stories, and essays, most autograph manuscript, unless otherwise identified, some with correspondence, clippings of reviews, or other related papers. Most writings are identified by literary genre; titles have not been verified, and some may be working titles. Other Writings include book reviews by McFee and introductions written by him for books by other authors, each roughly arranged alphabetically by title of book. Autograph manuscript diaries, 1911-1963, concern McFee's writing, as well as marine engineering work, ship voyages, and his family.

relatedmaterial.head: Related Materials
relatedmaterial.p: The Printed Material subseries and scrapbooks in the Personal Papers subseries include additional clippings of reviews for McFee's writings. Additional clippings of writings by McFee are in scrapbooks in the Printed Material and Personal Papers subseries.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: Arranged alphabetically by title; followed by Other Writings arranged by genre; and unidentified writings.

scopecontent.p: For more information, see catalog cards in each file

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Published as Blackkerchief Dick (New York: Doubleday, Page, & Co., 1923), with an introduction by McFee

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: With notes by William McFee

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Contains mostly clippings, including reviews of writings by McFee, other articles about him, and possibly writings by him. Also present are publications of the Shakespeare Fellowship and other materials relating to McFee's interest in William Shakespeare.

relatedmaterial.head: Related Materials
relatedmaterial.p: Additional clippings are present in the Writings and Personal Papers subseries.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Contains legal documents, some relating to McFee's father, merchant ship captain John Henry McFee; records of ship voyages and other papers relating to marine engineering; and scrapbooks containing clippings, writings, photographs, and ephemera.

relatedmaterial.head: Related Materials
relatedmaterial.p: Additional clippings are present in the Writings and Printed Materials subseries.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Contains clippings about McFee; photographs of McFee, family, and friends; fragments of writings by McFee; and ephemera relating to marine engineering and travel

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Contains mostly clippings about McFee and clippings of his writings, with some correspondence and ephemera

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Most photographs and drawings are portraits of McFee; also present are images of his family, friends, places of residence, and ships. Portraits of McFee include drawings by Arthur J. Elder and a bronze bust by Jason Sturm (Yale 1922).

relatedmaterial.head: Related Materials
relatedmaterial.p: Additional photographs are present in the Correspondence subseries and in scrapbooks in the Personal Papers subseries.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Includes fragment of Harbours of Memory , autograph manuscript

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Includes drawings by Arthur J. Elder; and woodblocks by unidentified artists

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: By Justin Sturm (Yale 1922)

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Contains materials relating to Babb's A Bibliography of the Writings of William McFee . Correspondence includes letters to and from McFee, and with vendors, concerning Babb's collection of McFee books and manuscripts.

relatedmaterial.head: Related Materials
relatedmaterial.p: Additional correspondence relating to Babb's research is in Third-Party Correspondence in the Correspondence subseries.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: Organized into five groupings: May 1995 Acquisition; January 1996 Acquisition; October 2000 Acquisition; February 2002 Acquisition; and Other Acquisitions.

scopecontent.p: Consists of individual accessions acquired 1979-2002. Writings by McFee are autograph manuscript, unless otherwise noted.
